inclusion.criterion: Cirrhosis diagnosed by either of the following in a patient with chronic liver disease
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Radiologic evidence of varices, cirrhosis or portal hypertension
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Laboratory evidence of platelet count <100,000 or AST/ALT ratio>1
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Endoscopic evidence of varices or portal gastropathy
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: On treatment for hepatic encephalopathy (patient can be on lactulose and rifaximin)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Able to give written, informed consent
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Women of child bearing potential must agree to use effective contraception for the duration of the study and for 10 days prior and 30 days after the study
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Negative pregnancy test in women of childbearing age
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: TIPS in place for less than a month
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Currently on antibiotics apart from rifaximin
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Infection at the time of the FMT (diagnosed by blood culture positivity, urinalysis, paracentesis as needed)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Hospitalization for any non-elective cause within the last 1 month
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 57-year-old farmer with Parkinson's disease. He experiences slowness of movement and tremors, but his medications help with shaking and slow movement.
